hook.text: A team spent two weeks debating a tool choice. They had no agreed way to make group decisions.

buildup.text: Without a decision protocol, every choice becomes a negotiation from scratch.

discovery.text: Common protocols: consensus, consent (no objections), majority vote, or designated decider.

twist.text: The worst protocol is no protocol. Even a bad one is faster than endless debate.

climax.text: Agree on how you decide before you need to decide. Then follow it consistently.

punchline.text: Decide how to decide. Everything else speeds up.

quiz.question: Why do teams need decision-making protocols?
options: Without them every choice becomes an unstructured negotiation
Protocols guarantee the best possible decision every time
Only large organizations need formal decision processes
